title: What will be the domestic box office gross in the opening week for Disney's Frozen 2, according to Box Office Mojo?
preds: Box office pro projecting 130 million for the weekend which reinforces my thinking from a month ago. Personally expecting it to earn in the high 130s for the weekend and an approx 32% rise in the week - this is the biggest challenge right now and i think it has a lot to do with demographic and reviews (which are coming in luke warm) if I'm wrong I'm underdoing it.

Updating my initial trailer views-based forecast [1] and model [2] to account for Box Office Report's recently released prediction [3] of $136MM opening weekend. Thought process: Initial trailer views-based forecast: $135,264,286
Seasonality adjustment: $178,756,665
Average with Box Office Report's prediction: $157,378,332 Full week adjustment (*1.27)/final projected mean: $199,324,835
Standard deviation: $33,098,996 Minor shifts from initial projection toward upper range. Model: 1%, 6%, 16%, 28%, 49%
Crowd: 5%, 6%, 23%, 39%, 27% [1] https://www.gjopen.com/comments/comments/914801
[2] https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1ZN2wk0VBJpuMyQy0ZZqL-1qJw8m_biLuuz5yo9n9hTE/edit#gid=1354379297
[3] http://www.boxofficereport.com/predictions/predictions.html
well.. it's tracking rather well isn't it?

My forecast is based on erroneous information. Not living in the US, I thought your Thanksgiving was last weekend (little did I know). I have a feeling this one will steamroller past the $200M mark, and I've made an enormous blunder. :-)

Hmmm.   I've listened to the proffered sound track songs, lost in the woods and whatever the other was  - and I think they're the wrong tone.   Nothing that feeds the empowered girl motif, nor catchy. I think that the november 22 opening will cut some of the initial weekend, as parents will think its great T-day fare.  And the six year gap for a sequel has proven death to other sequels.    I'm scaling my projections way back, and wishing I had waited before predicting.  Finally, lets not forget the original movie had $100 mil week - its outstanding success was on the legs of innumerable repeat visits.   This is a straight family fare movie - there's really nothing here for adults. There is no doubt that the sky is the limit for this film.  I expect the ultimate gross to be quite respectable.  Finally, https://www.slashfilm.com/frozen-ii-box-office-forecast/  predicting $115-$145 Anyone have interesting comments/statistics on rest of week vs opening weekend sales projections?
It is a phenomenon- Disney hit the jackpot with Frozen.

The highest grossing film in the opening week has been Avengers Endgame. Factors to consider, weekday would be less given that there is school and parents may be working, therefore there is a a greater reliance on the weekend compared to a movie such as avengers which could rely on the evenings. This means an over reliance on 2 days of the week. 
Approx 5000  cinemas in the US, 
Approx 10 screens per 
average 150 seats per screen 
variable I am not sure about is the number of screens dedicated to the showing and the number of showings.  the popularity of the first frozen does lean me to it having a big number however

I'm overexposed on 200+ and feeling chicken. 
Current thinking: scale back a bit and readjust closer to release and then day after release.
Will explain later. Essentially not seeing the same level of interest as original Frozen, but more will come out to watch in the first week.
Discussed with my 3,5 year old daughter who loves Frozen and Quinn Elsa

This is by no means an accurate forecast... but I've reflected on a few things which I've summarised after reading around (this article is pretty good at illustrating them) https://www.forbes.com/sites/scottmendelson/2019/06/10/frozen-ii-wont-suffer-the-grim-fates-of-lego-movie-2-and-godzilla-2/#27a56eb51263 1. 5 year wait... the original mass audience has somewhat out grown the franchise. ( @kerryb initially pointed this out ) But it's reflected in search results.
2. Typically sequals never do as well in their lifetime box office run... (article above shows this, but I'm wondering if theres an inverse effect on the first week. My thinking is more go at the start because it's an established franchise).
3. I wasn't placing enough emphasis on the month of November. While catching fire made a helluva lot of money for a sequel, the trend is that movies make less than if they are released in summer, meaning my comparisons with TS4 and Lion King are overly optimistic. My projections from now on are going to be leveraged on whether or not the franchise is still alive... theres a slight uptick in recent weeks but not enough to justify any broken records... (I'm not expecting a new November record but it doesn't need to break that record to reach that top bracket anyway). Will update...
Based on the overwhelming hype by the current young generation of parents coupled with social media.

Turns out thanks giving weekend is the following weekend (thurs 28th) so previous thinking is null and void. Easily comparable to ts4 and @dglid has done the analysis on view count. But what I'm more interested in is early sentiment indicators. Ts4 trailer 1 has 56 million views on the main trailer with 1 million likes.
Ts4 trailer 2 has 22 million views and 248k likes. Frozen 2 trailer 1 has 81 million views and 846k likes.
The second trailer has 15 million views and 276k likes. Its still early and those view counts will likely go up by 20% up until release date so i'd say sentiment for frozen is higher by about 10% and it seems to be attracting a larger audience based on view stats. Which is more than backed up by franchise comparison on google trends -> https://prnt.sc/pj7jig
When comparing with Lion king things get even more interesting https://prnt.sc/pj7ntv
Decided to compare to Hunger games catching fire since that was mentioned which currently has the highest opening weekend for a November release and racked up $222 Million for it's opening week https://prnt.sc/pj7ryg Note that Hunger games opened on the same day (Nov 22nd) and it was unaffected by Thanks Giving. I haven't done any of my fairy land maths yet but considering ts4 made 178 Mil in its opening week and Lion King being a comparable franchise (admittedly not as old but we're going by search results here) made 275 Mil .... I think we're looking north of Toy story and possibly even Hunger games, but lower than Lion King (these are my boundaries)... I'd actually expect something around the 210 mark. But given most of the numbers on these family friendly franchises are safely above the 175 Mil mark, it kind of makes it easy to write those lower brackets out. If I'm going to change this projection it's likely going to be up... What's holding me at 70% for the top bracket is this lingering feeling that it's a crummy sequel... (Just like Toy story 4!) Can anyone tell me if spam projecting in one day will hurt my final projection for that day?

I'm repurposing my model [1] from the Once Upon a Time In Hollywood [2] and Joker [3] questions that uses trailer views, time remaining until opening weekend, seasonality adjustments, and forecasts from prediction sites to project weekly (note: not just opening weekend) gross. My original projection for Once Upon a Time In Hollywood was $71.6MM [4]. My final projection was $52.7MM [5]. Final result was $58.8MM. I was worse than the crowd, with an accuracy score of 0.078. My original projection for Joker was $99.9MM [6]. My final projection was $105.0MM [7]. Final result was $137.8MM. I was better than the crowd, with an accuracy score of -0.008. Find my model for Frozen 2 here [1]. My opening weekend, seasonality-adjusted projection based on trailer views is $179.1MM, which is projecting a significantly bigger take than the top range of BoxOfficePro's long range forecast of $115-145MM [8]. I use the average of my trailer-based prediction and BoxOfficePro's long range forecast to get a $154.6MM projected opening weekend. Extrapolate that out for the entire week and I end up with a mean of $195.8MM. I calculate a standard deviation by averaging the typical variation of BoxOfficeReport's predictions [9] of similar movies (within 10% of projected mean either way) to actual results. I will update my projection ~weekly with new trailer numbers and average BoxOfficeReport's final prediction expected November 22th, at which point I'll remove BoxOfficePro's long range forecast from my final average. In conclusion: Forecasted mean: $195,765,156
Standard deviation: $32,434,371 Model: 1%, 7%, 18%, 29%, 45%
Crowd: 56%, 15%, 8%, 13%, 8% P.s. Model updates: I made two changes to the model this time around, one significant and one insignificant:
1. Significant change: After running the model the first time, I got a forecast of well over $200k. This seemed due to the inclusion of trailer data for non-blockbuster movies which was skewing the data upward. To address this, I've limited the baseline data for projecting revenue by trailer counts to only movies within 10% of BoxOfficePro's long-range forecast of Frozen 2. This puts Frozen 2 in the company of Toy Story 4, Captain Marvel, Jurassic World, Deadpool 2,Thor: Ragnarok, IT, Spider-Man: Homecoming, and Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 2. 
2. Insignificant change: I updated the standard deviation to match the same bucket of comps as in #1. [1] https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1ZN2wk0VBJpuMyQy0ZZqL-1qJw8m_biLuuz5yo9n9hTE/edit#gid=1354379297
[2] https://www.gjopen.com/questions/1237-what-will-be-the-domestic-box-office-gross-in-the-opening-week-for-quentin-tarantino-s-once-upon-a-time-in-hollywood-according-to-boxofficemojo
[3] https://www.gjopen.com/questions/1281-what-will-be-the-domestic-box-office-gross-in-the-opening-week-for-warner-bros-joker-according-to-box-office-mojo
[4] https://www.gjopen.com/comments/comments/883427
[5] https://www.gjopen.com/comments/comments/888228

[7] https://www.gjopen.com/comments/comments/911456

[9] http://www.boxofficereport.com/predictions/predictions.html

Only just saw this.. wish I read it sooner, kind of assumed the block of questions were related to Hong Kong... Opening 22nd November? 
As someone else already mentioned... it's thanks giving, limited opening, do theatres close around this time of year?  Need to find movies to compare to and analyse the opening weekend in more detail but frozen made 26 million in its opening week and that too opened 22 November. At face value I'd say it has an opening week in the 40 - 60 million range.

Movies that debut just before the thanksgiving do not gross as well as movies that open during the spring season or the summer season. The highest grossing movie  pre-thanksgiving is the hunger games- catching fire: $109MM. It is unlikely Frozen 2 will surpass this greatly.

Children movies typically run lower on box office overall. Now a days marketing has upgraded to a new level pinpointing correct target and exploit. Based on first part, it has very high expectations for earnings.
